metadata.title: CVE-2022-28615 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
Apache HTTP Server 2.4.53 and earlier may crash or disclose information dueto a read beyond bounds in ap_strcmp_match() when provided with anextremely large input buffer. While no code distributed with the server canbe coerced into such a call, third-party modules or lua scripts that useap_strcmp_match() may hypothetically be affected.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-28615` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

apache2 - 2.4.7-1ubuntu4.22+esm6
apache2-bin - 2.4.7-1ubuntu4.22+esm6
apache2-data - 2.4.7-1ubuntu4.22+esm6
apache2-mpm-event - 2.4.7-1ubuntu4.22+esm6
apache2-mpm-itk - 2.4.7-1ubuntu4.22+esm6
apache2-mpm-prefork - 2.4.7-1ubuntu4.22+esm6
apache2-mpm-worker - 2.4.7-1ubuntu4.22+esm6
apache2-suexec - 2.4.7-1ubuntu4.22+esm6
apache2-suexec-custom - 2.4.7-1ubuntu4.22+esm6
apache2-suexec-pristine - 2.4.7-1ubuntu4.22+esm6
apache2-utils - 2.4.7-1ubuntu4.22+esm6
apache2.2-bin - 2.4.7-1ubuntu4.22+esm6
libapache2-mod-macro - 1:2.4.7-1ubuntu4.22+esm6
libapache2-mod-proxy-html - 1:2.4.7-1ubuntu4.22+esm6
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro
